div1.head: Letter from P.M. Hamer to Philip Showalter Hench, April 1, 1942
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
1934
DIVISION OF REFERENCE
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
April 1, 1942.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This is in reply to your letter of March 19 concern-
ing entries for Walter Reed and Guy M. Godfrey in the Registers
of Medical Officers prior to 1898.

Registers of Medical Officers are on file which contain
the record of Walter Reed from 1875 through 1897, and of Guy
Charles Moore Godfrey from 1893 through 1897. The following are
estimates of the cost of negative photostats of the record for
each period as covered in a single volume: for Walter Reed,
1875-1878, 75 cents; 1879-1885, 90 cents; 1886-1890, 50 cents;
1891-1893, 65 cents; 1894-1897, 25 cents; for Guy C. M. Godfrey,
1893, 25 cents; 1894-1897, 80 cents.

If you wish to order any or all of these photostats,
please forward your remittance to this office by certified check
or money order made payable to the Treasurer of the United States.

closer.signed:
P. M. Hamer,
Director of Reference Service
